explanation: The report is correct. In the shown code conn_header is only used to read fields (asserts and string checks) and is never used to modify the pointed-to object. Assigning response->first_header (a non-const pointer) to a pointer-to-const is allowed, so declaring conn_header as const struct MHD_HTTP_Res_Header *conn_header; would be both possible and appropriate to express immutability and satisfy MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13. No evidence in the shown code requires conn_header to be a pointer-to-non-const, so the current declaration is a breach of the rule.
